spread out.translation[0].definitions[0]: if a group of people spread out, they move apart from each other so that they cover a wider area
The search party spread out to search the surrounding fields.
spread out.translation[0].definitions[1]: to open something out or arrange a group of things on a flat surface
Sue spread out her notes on the kitchen table and began to write.
spread out.translation[0].definitions[2]: The city spread out below her looked so calm.
spread out.translation[0].definitions[3]: to do something over a period of time, rather than at one time
The course is spread out over four days.
